intro: Apargia vulgaris, commonly known as the common bluebell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers in the spring. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Apargia vulgaris is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
